com.camerontec.catalys.core.session

Interface IConnectionPointConfiguration

  • All Superinterfaces:
    INotifySupport
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ConnectionPointConfigInMemory

    public interface IConnectionPointConfiguration
extends INotifySupport
    Interface for accessing connection point related configuration information.

    Information about connection points is kept in this object rather than directly associated with the connectionPoint object so that connectionPoint objects are effectively just simple indexes which can be created purely from their parties.

    Fires following events:

    • NewConnectionPointEvent
    • DeletedConnectionPointEvent
    • NewSessionManagerEvent
    • ConfigurationChangeEvent

    Configuration information relating to a FIX connection point is typically kept in some sort of persistent central store. The exact nature of that store may be a data base, a set of Java properties files, an XML document, a remote service and so on.
    Whatever the nature of the store, it must present this standard interface. Different types of store will simply be different implementations of this interface.

    Configuration information includes:

    • List of all known connection points.
    • List of all connections to a connection point.
    • The Session associated with each connection point.
    • The SessionManager associated with each connection point.
    The assumptions are:
    • Each connection relates to only one connection point but a connection point can have many connections.
    • Each connection point only has a single Session.

      • getSession

        Session getSession(IConnectionPoint connectionPoint)
        Retrieve the Session associated with the given connection point.
        Parameters:
        connectionPoint - a connection point
        Returns:
        Session for connection point. Null if none.

      • setSession

        void setSession(IConnectionPoint connectionPoint,
                Session session)
        Associate the session with the given connection point.

        Replaces any existing session associated with the connection point.

        If session is null, any session at that connection point and any other data related to that connectonPoint (connections, session managers etc) is deleted.

        Parameters:
        connectionPoint - a connection point
        session - a session

      • getSessionManager

        ISessionManager getSessionManager(IConnectionPoint connectionPoint)
        Retrieve the session manager associated with the given connection point.
        Parameters:
        connectionPoint - a connection point
        Returns:
        Session manager for connection point. Null if none.

        Parameters:

        sessionManager - a session manager

      • getStartTask

        @Deprecated
IScheduledTask getStartTask(IConnectionPoint connectionPoint)
        Deprecated. use getStartTasks(IConnectionPoint) instead.
        Retrieve the scheduled task used by the scheduler to start this connectionPoint's session.

        Null if no such task or if no scheduler is being used. This method is deprecated because connectionPoint may have multiple start and stop tasks.

        Parameters:
        connectionPoint - a connection point
        Returns:
        Task used to start connectionPoint's session or null if none. If multiple start tasks exist for connectionPoint, it is non-deterministic which one is returned.

      • getStartTasks

        Set<IScheduledTask> getStartTasks(IConnectionPoint connectionPoint)
        Retrieve the set of scheduled tasks used by the scheduler to start this connectionPoint's session.

        Null if connectionPoint is null.

        Parameters:
        connectionPoint - a connection point
        Returns:
        Set of IScheduledTasks used to start connectionPoint's session.

        Parameters:

        startTask - Scheduled task used to start connectionPoint's session. Null if none.

      • getResetTasks

        Set<IScheduledTask> getResetTasks(IConnectionPoint connectionPoint)
        Retrieve the scheduled tasks used by the scheduler to reset this connectionPoint's session.

        Null if no such task or if no scheduler is being used.

        Parameters:
        connectionPoint - Connection point from which reset tasks are retrieved from.
        Returns:
        Tasks used to reset connectionPoint's session or null if none. If multiple reset tasks exist for connectionPoint, it is non-deterministic which one is returned.
